observation.content: Task list has been updated with 6 item(s).

task_list.title: Analyze and understand the ignore-paths issue with recursive mode
task_list.notes: Found that the issue is with mixed path separators. When os.walk() returns paths with backslashes (Windows) but os.path.join() creates mixed separators like 'src\gen/bad.py', these don't match the regex patterns '^src\\gen\\.*$|^src/gen/.*$'.

task_list.title: Create comprehensive test cases to reproduce the issue
task_list.notes: Created multiple test scripts that confirmed the mixed separator issue. The current implementation works for pure Windows or pure POSIX paths, but fails for mixed separators.

task_list.title: Identify the root cause in the codebase
task_list.notes: The issue is in _is_ignored_file() function in expand_modules.py line 59, where paths with mixed separators don't match the regex patterns created by _regexp_paths_csv_transfomer().

task_list.title: Implement fix to normalize paths before regex matching
task_list.notes: Modified _is_ignored_file() to normalize path separators by converting backslashes to forward slashes before checking against ignore_list_paths_re patterns.

task_list.title: Create test to verify the fix works
task_list.notes: Create a test that reproduces the mixed separator scenario and verifies the fix works correctly.

task_list.title: Run existing tests to ensure no regressions
task_list.notes: Run pylint's existing test suite to make sure the fix doesn't break anything.
